title: Michelle Obama to release a journal companion to her bestselling memoir Becoming at $20 a copy
text:
Michelle Obama will be releasing a companion piece to her bestselling memoir Becoming next month, the former first lady's publisher announced on Monday.

Becoming: A Guided Journal for Discovering Your Voice will hit bookshelves on November 19 said Penguin Random House in a press release, almost one year after the release of Obama's memoir.

For $20, readers will get a new introduction from Obama, over 100 questions and quotes that are relevant to her memoir Becoming and some pages to start their own journal.

A press release from the publisher notes that worldwide rights for the journal were acquired from the author's literary agents, suggesting that Obama stands to make money on top of the reported $65 million she and her husband were already paid by Penguin Random House for their post-White House memoirs.

Becoming has sold 11.5 million copies in the past year, and been printed in 45 languages. There is still no tentative release date for Barack Obama's memoir.

Becoming rich: Michelle Obama (above in November of last year on her book tour) will release Becoming: A Guided Journal for Discovering Your Voice on November 19 announced published Penguin Random House

'Featuring an intimate introduction by Mrs. Obama, the Becoming journal includes more than 150 inspiring questions and quotes that resonate with key themes in Mrs. Obama’s memoir and that are designed to help readers reflect on their personal and family history, their goals, challenges, and dreams, what moves them and brings them hope, and what future they imagine for themselves and their community,' said the publisher in a statement.

An initial print of 500,000 copies has already been ordered by Penguin Random House.

The journal will also be 'printed cream writing paper, with a grosgrain ribbon and a foil-stamped cover and removable half-jacket.'

Obama is hoping that with this journal, readers can find their voice much like she found her own as detailed in Becoming.

'I hope you’ll use this journal to write down your experiences, thoughts, and feelings, in all their imperfections, and without judgment,' writes Obama in the introduction.

'We don’t have to remember everything. But everything we remember has value.'

And always one to go high, Obama waited until after the release of Hillary and Chelsea Clinton's new book Gutsy Girls to announce her big news.

Becoming was the bestselling book of 2018 in the United States, moving 3.4 million copies in less than two months according to NPD Bookscan data.

It also looks likely to repeat that feat again this year, unless Becoming is bested by its companion piece.
